channel.title: CVE Feed for Canonical Ltd. -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Canonical Ltd. -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-1523|2024-10-01T13:08:45.851Z -- canonical%20ltd. -- snapd
item.description: Using the TIOCLINUX ioctl request, a malicious snap could inject contents into the input of the controlling terminal which could allow it to cause arbitrary commands to be executed outside of the snap sandbox after the snap exits. Graphical terminal emulators like xterm, gnome-terminal and others are not affected - this can only be exploited when snaps are run on a virtual console.

item.title: CVE-2024-8287|2024-09-19T20:25:24.637Z -- canonical%20ltd. -- anbox%20cloud
item.description: Anbox Management Service, in versions 1.17.0 through 1.23.0, does not validate the TLS certificate provided to it by the Anbox Stream Agent. An attacker must be able to machine-in-the-middle the Anbox Stream Agent from within an internal network before they can attempt to take advantage of this.

item.title: CVE-2024-5290|2024-09-18T15:39:53.818Z -- canonical%20ltd. -- wpa_supplicant
item.description:
An issue was discovered in Ubuntu wpa_supplicant that resulted in loading of arbitrary shared objects, which allows a local unprivileged attacker to escalate privileges to the user that wpa_supplicant runs as (usually root).
Membership in the netdev group or access to the dbus interface of wpa_supplicant allow an unprivileged user to specify an arbitrary path to a module to be loaded by the wpa_supplicant process; other escalation paths might exist.

item.title: CVE-2024-5138|2024-09-06T19:48:49.508Z -- canonical%20ltd. -- snapd
item.description: The snapctl component within snapd allows a confined snap to interact with the snapd daemon to take certain privileged actions on behalf of the snap. It was found that snapctl did not properly parse command-line arguments, allowing an unprivileged user to trigger an authorised action on behalf of the snap that would normally require administrator privileges to perform. This could possibly allow an unprivileged user to perform a denial of service or similar.

item.title: CVE-2022-28658|2024-08-19T13:49:33.090Z -- canonical%20ltd. -- apport
item.description: Apport argument parsing mishandles filename splitting on older kernels resulting in argument spoofing

item.title: CVE-2024-5290|2024-08-07T14:40:06.238Z -- canonical%20ltd. -- wpa_supplicant
item.description:
An issue was discovered in Ubuntu wpa_supplicant that resulted in loading of arbitrary shared objects, which allows a local unprivileged attacker to escalate privileges to the user that wpa_supplicant runs as (usually root).
Membership in the netdev group or access to the dbus interface of wpa_supplicant allow an unprivileged user to specify an arbitrary path to a module to be loaded by the wpa_supplicant process; other escalation paths might exist.

item.title: CVE-2022-28655|2024-08-06T14:59:11.898Z -- canonical%20ltd. -- apport
item.description: is_closing_session() allows users to create arbitrary tcp dbus connections

item.title: CVE-2022-28652|2024-08-05T17:47:51.218Z -- canonical%20ltd. -- apport
item.description: ~/.config/apport/settings parsing is vulnerable to "billion laughs" attack

item.title: CVE-2022-28656|2024-08-05T15:37:09.584Z -- canonical%20ltd. -- apport
item.description: is_closing_session() allows users to consume RAM in the Apport process

item.title: CVE-2020-27352|2024-08-04T16:11:36.612Z -- canonical%20ltd. -- snapd
item.description: When generating the systemd service units for the docker snap (and other similar snaps), snapd does not specify Delegate=yes - as a result systemd will move processes from the containers created and managed by these snaps into the cgroup of the main daemon within the snap itself when reloading system units. This may grant additional privileges to a container within the snap that were not originally intended.

item.title: CVE-2021-3899|2024-08-03T17:09:09.767Z -- canonical%20ltd. -- apport
item.description: There is a race condition in the 'replaced executable' detection that, with the correct local configuration, allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code as root.

item.title: CVE-2022-28652|2024-08-03T05:56:16.323Z -- canonical%20ltd. -- apport
item.description: ~/.config/apport/settings parsing is vulnerable to "billion laughs" attack

item.title: CVE-2022-28655|2024-08-03T05:56:16.459Z -- canonical%20ltd. -- apport
item.description: is_closing_session() allows users to create arbitrary tcp dbus connections

item.title: CVE-2022-28654|2024-08-03T05:56:16.351Z -- canonical%20ltd. -- apport
item.description: is_closing_session() allows users to fill up apport.log

item.title: CVE-2022-28658|2024-08-03T05:56:16.460Z -- canonical%20ltd. -- apport
item.description: Apport argument parsing mishandles filename splitting on older kernels resulting in argument spoofing

item.title: CVE-2022-28657|2024-08-03T05:56:16.428Z -- canonical%20ltd. -- apport
item.description: Apport does not disable python crash handler before entering chroot

item.title: CVE-2022-28656|2024-08-03T05:56:16.393Z -- canonical%20ltd. -- apport
item.description: is_closing_session() allows users to consume RAM in the Apport process

item.title: CVE-2022-4968|2024-08-03T01:55:46.232Z -- canonical%20ltd. -- netplan
item.description: netplan leaks the private key of wireguard to local users. Versions after 1.0 are not affected.

item.title: CVE-2024-5138|2024-08-01T21:03:10.778Z -- canonical%20ltd. -- snapd
item.description: The snapctl component within snapd allows a confined snap to interact with the snapd daemon to take certain privileged actions on behalf of the snap. It was found that snapctl did not properly parse command-line arguments, allowing an unprivileged user to trigger an authorised action on behalf of the snap that would normally require administrator privileges to perform. This could possibly allow an unprivileged user to perform a denial of service or similar.

item.title: CVE-2024-6388|2024-08-01T21:41:03.306Z -- canonical%20ltd. -- ubuntu%20advantage%20desktop%20pro
item.description: Marco Trevisan discovered that the Ubuntu Advantage Desktop Daemon, before version 1.12, leaks the Pro token to unprivileged users by passing the token as an argument in plaintext.

item.title: CVE-2024-6984|2024-08-01T21:45:38.419Z -- canonical%20ltd. -- juju
item.description: An issue was discovered in Juju that resulted in the leak of the sensitive context ID, which allows a local unprivileged attacker to access other sensitive data or relation accessible to the local charm.

item.title: CVE-2024-6714|2024-08-01T21:41:04.325Z -- canonical%20ltd. -- ubuntu%20desktop%20provision
item.description: An issue was discovered in provd before version 0.1.5 with a setuid binary, which allows a local attacker to escalate their privilege.

item.title: CVE-2024-3250|2024-07-29T15:14:37.228Z -- canonical%20ltd. -- pebble
item.description: It was discovered that Canonical's Pebble service manager read-file API and the associated pebble pull command, before v1.10.2, allowed unprivileged local users to read files with root-equivalent permissions when Pebble was running as root. Fixes are also available as backports to v1.1.1, v1.4.2, and v1.7.4.

item.title: CVE-2024-6714|2024-07-24T19:04:10.579Z -- canonical%20ltd. -- ubuntu%20desktop%20provision
item.description: An issue was discovered in provd before version 0.1.5 with a setuid binary, which allows a local attacker to escalate their privilege.

item.title: CVE-2020-27352|2024-07-09T20:56:52.326Z -- canonical%20ltd. -- snapd
item.description: When generating the systemd service units for the docker snap (and other similar snaps), snapd does not specify Delegate=yes - as a result systemd will move processes from the containers created and managed by these snaps into the cgroup of the main daemon within the snap itself when reloading system units. This may grant additional privileges to a container within the snap that were not originally intended.

item.description: netplan leaks the private key of wireguard to local users. Versions after 1.0 are not affected.

This may grant additional privileges to a container within the snap that were not originally intended.

item.title: CVE-2022-4968|2024-06-20T15:32:45.752Z -- canonical%20ltd. -- netplan
item.description: netplan leaks the private key of wireguard to local users. A security fix will be released soon.
